para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, abono orgánico
to purchase manure, fertilizers and organic additives

loans.name: Edgar Edison

texts.es:
Edgar Edison,  tiene 22 años de edad es soltero, vive con su hermano,  en Guaranda,  provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC Arte y Cultura  “Wari” se encuentra en la comunidad de Larkaloma a 45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios.

Edgar  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas,  además  a la producción de quesos y crianza de ganado y pollos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, líquidos, insecticidas, abono orgánico, vacunas y balanceado. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá tener su propio negocio de pollos.

Las compras y las ventas lo hacen en Guaranda semanalmente.

El sueño es poder tener una camioneta para transportar los productos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las vías de comunicación.
 En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar, hacer música y la ápoca que más disfruta es la navidad.
texts.en: Edgar Edison is 22 years old, single and lives with his brother in Guaranda, in the Bolívar Province.  The VRC Art and Culture "Wari" is found in the town of Larkaloma about 45 minutes from the office, and consists of 11 members.  Edgar makes a living in agriculture planting potatoes, as well as making cheese and raising livestock and chickens.  He is requesting this loan to purchase supplies, pesticides, organic additives, vaccines and animal feed, with which he will be able to have his own business raising chickens.  Buying and selling occur weekly in Guaranda.  His dream is to be able to have a truck to be able to transport his products, while the challenges he faces are means of communication.  In his free time he likes to rest from work, make music and he most enjoys the Christmas season.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, pesticides, organic additives, vaccines and animal feed.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is a married woman. She has five children and all are enrolled in school. Dorris operates a retail shop and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are neighbors and town dwellers. Dorris' other source of income includes her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for her family. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Dorris will use the Kes 40,000 loan to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. Dorris aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is from Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Lilia is married and has five children. 

To make a living, Lilia is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community, such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo,soaps and many other items. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Lilia is requesting a loan of 5,608 PHP, which will be used to purchase milk, potato chips, sugar, salt, soy sauce, vinegar, soap, bread, and soft drinks. In 2007, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to to save as a reserve for future emergencies				.

loans.use: to purchase milk, potato chips, sugar, salt, soy sauce, vinegar, soap, bread, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is 24-year-old single woman who lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past year, she has operated a tailoring business from home, whereby her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business. Selina decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a single woman who lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent bills.

For the past two years, she has operated a second hand clothes selling business, selling in a shop to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. Her major dream is to establish a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Adélaïde Afiavi's Group

texts.fr: Adélaïde, responsable du groupe de deux personnes est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de calebasses, paniers, pierre à moudre, ustensiles de cuisine et de tisane. En vue de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un micro-crédit à Finadev pour renforcer son activité et pour le bien-être de sa famille. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à droite de la photo.
texts.en:
Adélaïde is the head of this group of two people. She is married and the mother of three children. Her main activity is the sale of calebasses (bottle gourds), baskets, grinding stones, kitchen utensils, and tisane. 

To meet the needs of her customers, she is seeking micro-financing from Finadev. This will help to strengthen her activity and ensure her family’s well-being. She is shown in the right-hand side photo.

loans.use: to buy 30 grinding stones, 20 baskets, and 10 kitchen utensils for resale.

loans.name: Afouchata

texts.fr:
Madame Afouchata est une femme mariée de plus 27 ans et mère de trois enfants qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Wayerma II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Madame Afouchata n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études, s’est vite initiée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de bois de chauffe il y a six années. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes. Ainsi, elle décida d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant plus trois ans. Après trois prêts solidaires dans une association des femmes de son quartier,  elle est maintenant à son premier prêt individuel.  
Ce premier prêt  individuel  lui, permettra d’acheter,  2 chargements de camion 10 tonnes en bois de chauffe dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre.
   Ses marchandises sont vendues à domicile et au marché du quartier, en gros et en détail à une clientèle diverse er variée.  
      Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour  réaliser l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Afouchata is a married woman over 27 years old  and the mother of three children. She lives with her husband and their children in Wayerma II, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

Not having had the chance to advance in her studies, Ms. Afouchata soon became familiar with revenue-generating businesses, especially the buying and selling of firewood six years ago. She enjoys a strong reputation in this business and receives many special orders. 

Thus, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After three solidarity loans with a women's association in her district, she is now on her first individual loan.

This first individual loan will enable her to buy two 10-tonne truck-loads of firewood from towns surrounding Sikasso in order to meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base. 

Her merchandise is sold out of her home and at the district market, wholesale and retail, to a diversity of customers.

With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover most of her expenses, help with family expenses, and pay the loan interest. The rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Aizada

texts.ru: Айзаде 32 года, замужем, имеет четверых детей. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2000 году Айзада начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммы в 16,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айзада обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. В будущем, Айзада хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Aizada is 32 years old, married and has four children.  She started her business in animal husbandry in 2000 with an initial amount of 16,000 som (KGS) to provide a source of income for her family.  Thanks to her persistence and diligence, today her business yields about 10,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat products.  In order to further develop her business, Aizada requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  In the future, Aizada wants to increase and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita forma parte del Banco comunal “Unidos Emprendemos con Esperanza”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la lavandería desde hace cuatro años. Trabaja de lunes a sábado desde su casa en horario flexible, ahí cuenta con maquinas para lavar ropa, centrifugas y secadoras. Sus clientes van a dejar y buscar sus prendas al domicilio de Margarita.
Su clientela es fija, ya que presta sus servicios periódicamente a empresas y esporádicamente a particulares.
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados y también a proveedores mayoristas.
Con el crédito comprará materiales de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de su local de trabajo, ya que necesita pavimentar el piso. 
Sus metas son seguir arreglando su local, para que esta infraestructura le permita captar una mayor clientela.
Margarita vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 17 y 7 años de edad, ambos estudian. Uno de los sueños de ella es que sus hijos logren ser profesionales. Y sus proyecciones personales son terminar su carrera de Técnico en enfermería, comenta que trabaja durante el día en su negocio y que estudia en horario vespertino.
Margarita está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el préstamo le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones del Banco comunal, comenta que han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio, ya que ha incorporado nuevas estrategias de contabilidad y organización. Por otro lado, el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy comprometido, lo cual la hace sentir muy cómoda.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
Margarita is part of the “Unidos Emprendemos con Esperanza” (Together We Enterprise with Hope) communal bank belonging to the city of Curicó.  Her line of work for the last four years has been a laundry.  She works Monday through Saturday from home with a flexible schedule.  She has washing machines, spinners and dryers there.  Her customers drop off and pick up their clothes at Margarita’s house.

Her clientele is regular since she periodically provides services to firms and occasionally to individuals.  She buys her merchandise in supermarkets and from wholesalers.  She will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies to improve the infrastructure of her place of work because she needs to pave the floor.  Her goal is to continue improving her locale so that the infrastructure will permit increasing her customer load.

Margarita lives with her husband and two children who are 17 and 7 years old; both attend school.  One of her dreams is that her children become professionals and one of her personal projects is to finish her technical nursing studies.  She comments that she works at her business during the morning and attends classes in the afternoon shift.

Margarita is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza because the loan will allow her to invest in her business.  With respect to the training provided during the communal bank meetings, she comments that they have been of great help to her for her business because she’s applied new bookkeeping and organizational strategies.  On the other hand, the group in the communal bank she’s part of is very committed which makes her feel very comfortable.

Curicó is located in the Maule region in the center of the country.  Curicó’s weather is Mediterranean so it’s considered to be one of the country’s most pleasant.  It’s noted for its culture related to wine production and for the natural beauty in its surroundings.  Even though employment has risen the zone continues to be, according to the latest census, one of the nation’s poorest.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Badamkhand

texts.en: Mrs. Badamkhand, 51, works as an office manager in a private transportation bureau. She lives with her husband and her 22-year-old son in an old house in the suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son, Batbaatar, graduated from his school last year, but he is still unemployed. Badamkhand wanted to take a loan to support her son to start a taxi business in near future. Batbaatar believes that it will assist to increase his family income and their life, but there is a lack of funds to pay the cost of purchasing a used car for his new business. Therefore, his mother, Badamkhand, wanted to support her son in starting to plan his business. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to cover the cost of her son’s purchasing a car for new business.

loans.use: to cover the cost of her son’s purchase of a car for new business.

loans.name: Alima

texts.ru:
Алиме 43 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Алима на протяжении 12 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с начальной суммы 8,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Алимы,  ее хозяйство на сегодняшний  день приносит около 7,000 сом в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алима обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Алима планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en: Alima is 43 years old, married and has two children. She has been involved in animal husbandry for 12 years, having started this business with an initial amount of 8,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her Alima's hard work, today her business yields about 7,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat products. In order to further develop her business, Alima requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into increasing the quantities of domestic livestock further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca solicita un nuevo préstamo ya que se encuentra en los tramites de legalizar el lugar donde reside y utilizara el dinero para los trámites jurídicos para legalizar a su nombre la propiedad.
El préstamo anterior lo utilizo para el negocio y le ha permitido mantenerse hasta el momento produciendo y ganando más clientes también considera que se está superando a través de estos aportes.
texts.en:
Francisca is asking for a new loan because she’s making the legal arrangements to register title to her property and will use the money to pay for the legal steps to put the property in her name.

She used the previous loan for the business and it’s made it possible for her to continue producing to date and winning over more customers.  She also feels that she’s improving thanks to these loans.

loans.use: to pay legal fees to register her property.

loans.name: Kelvin Isael

texts.es:
Kelvin se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para comprar alimentos para el ganado como la harinilla y el sácate molido ya que por la época del año los pastos están secos y esta compra le dará lo necesario para mantener la ganadería.
El manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior logro realizar la siembra de maíz, que su familia se encuentra estable sin ningún inconveniente que les afecte.
texts.en: Kelvin has decided on a new loan to buy cattle feed like ‘harinilla” and ground grass because during this time of year grasses are dry and this purchase will give him what he needs to feed his cattle.  He states that he was able to use the previous loan to plant corn and that his family is stable with no inconvenience affecting them.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sweet and French bread.

loans.name: Maria Macedonia

texts.es:
María, desea seguir cultivando maíz, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de abono, semilla, herbicidas y pago de mozos con esto iniciara nuevamente el cultivo del que espera recibir una buena cosecha.
María a través del último préstamo a logrado relazar su trabajo agrícola del que se ha mantenido ella y su familia  en una condición adecuada de vida.
texts.en:
María wishes to continue growing corn.  Therefore, she is requesting a new loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, and to pay laborers.  With this she will start her crop again.  She hopes to get a good harvest from this crop.

Through the last loan María has managed to do her farm work, which has supported her and her family with an adequate quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman.  She has two daughters.  She describes herself to be optimistic. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells fruits and vegetables such as kale, oranges, mangoes, etc.  She has been involved in this business for two years.  Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.  

She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.  Her business goal is to run a fully stocked grocery stall within five years.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is a 35-year-old farmer from the Adigeni District in South Georgia.  He lives in a village with his wife Leila, two sons aged 12 and 10 years and his retired parents.  Both children attend school. 

Tamaz and Leila earn a living by running agricultural businesses.  They have a milk cow and two calves, which produce products that are mainly consumed by the family.  A small surplus of cheese is sold on the local market.  In addition, the family owns a plot of land.  They grow potato, maize and haricot beans.  Tamaz sells the harvested products to local greengrocery retailers.  The family’s total average monthly income is 500 Laris, including the pensions of Tamaz’s parents. 

Tamaz has requested a loan in order to purchase feed for calves.  Tamaz will raise the calves and produce more milk in the family farm.  The family will be able to produce and sell more cheese, enabling them to earn additional income.  With the increased income, Tamaz and Leila will be able to purchase needed household goods to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the calves.

loans.name: Yvette's Group

texts.fr: Agée de 40ans, Yvette est responsable de groupe de deux personnes. Mère de deux enfants, Yvette vit en location avec son mari. Couturière de formation, elle y associe la vente des produits de la pharmacopée et GSM dans une boutique sise à son domicile.  Soucieuse de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite et obtient un concours auprès de  Finadev afin d'accroître son  stock et participer aux charges familiales. La responsable est celle qui se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
Yvette is 40 years old, and she represents a two-person group.  She has two children and lives in a rented place with her husband.  A seamstress by training, she also sells pharmaceutical products and GSM phones in a shop located where she lives.
In order to strengthen her business, she has requested and obtained assistance from Finadev.  This will allow her to increase her stock and participate in family expenses.  Yvette is the woman shown in the left photograph.

loans.use: to buy 15 "pagnes" (colorful West African fabrics) and other goods.

loans.name: Mohamedi

texts.fr:
Né vers 1988 à Sikasso ville, Monsieur Mohamedi est célibataire sans enfant résidant  vivant dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Kaboïla II, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
 Monsieur Mohamedi  n’ayant pas la chance d’avancer dans les études, s’est initié il y a dix ans à cette activité d’achat-vente des fruits et légumes  et tubercules (pomme de terre, orange, citron, patate, igname etc.). Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes au niveau da Bamako, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, il intégra Soro Yiriwaso il y a quelque année et est à son quatrième prêt individuel. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce nouveau crédit lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour enfin répondre aux attentes de ses clients.
 Ainsi ce quatrième crédit lui permettra d’acheter dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso, 20 sacs de pomme de terre, 25 sacs d’orange, 30 sacs de citron et 35 sacs de patate. Ses ventes sont faites en gros et en détail à une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales mais surtout de restaurateurs.  
Avec ce crédit, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1988 in Sikasso City, Mr. Mohamedi is an unmarried man without children and living in a large traditional family in Kaboïla II, a working-class district in Sikasso City. 

Not having had the chance to advance in his studies, Mr. Mohamedi became familiar with this business buying and selling fruit,  vegetables, and tubers (potatoes, oranges, limes, sweet potatoes, yams, etc.)  With such experience in this domain, he enjoys a strong reputation and accommodates many special orders from Bamako. 

But the resources necessary to meet these needs are lacking. Thus, he joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso a few years ago and is now on his fourth individual loan. The previous loans were all correctly repaid. This new loan will enable him to increase his business capital to respond to the expectations of his customers.  

And so this fourth loan will allow him to buy from towns surrounding Sikasso the following goods: 20 sacks of  potatoes, 25 sacks of oranges, 30 sacks of limes, and 35 sacks of sweet potatoes. 

His sales are made wholesale and retail to a customer base composed of all walks of life but especially restauranteurs. 

With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be use to resolve most of his expenses and his family's expenses and to pay the loan interest. The rest will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy food supplies

loans.name: Jackelin Marlene

texts.es:
Jaqueline, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para invertir en la venta de tortillas, comprara maíz y gas propano que son los materiales necesarios para la producción de las tortillas.
Ella considera haber tenido un efecto positivo con los préstamos anteriores fortaleciendo sus ventas y mejorando poco a poco sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en: Jaqueline has decided on a new loan to invest in her tortilla sales; she will buy corn and propane gas which are the materials necessary to make tortillas.  She considers that her previous loans had positive effects strengthening her sales and gradually improving family income.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane gas.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa se decidió por un nuevo préstamo ya que está iniciando el cultivo de maíz y lo utilizara para pagar mano de obra y comprar el abono y la semilla, con esto tendrá la seguridad de iniciar su trabajo en la tierra.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior mejoro la productividad de sus cultivos y esto también le ha fortalecido la condición y el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Rosa has decided on a new loan because she’s starting a new corn crop and will use it to pay labor costs and to buy manure and seeds so that she will be sure to start her work in the field.  She feels that the previous loan helped to improve productivity of her crops and this also strengthened her condition and her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and to buy manure and seeds.

loans.name: Deisy Tamara

texts.es:
Deisy está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en su tienda ya que quiere aumentar la disponibilidad de algunos productos como café instantáneo, sopas, refrescos artificiales, gaseosas, galletas, boquitas ya que son de la preferencia de los clientes.
Ella a tenido un efecto positivo con la inversión anterior dándole una mejor condición de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Deisy is asking for a new loan to invest in her store because she wants to increase availability of some products like instant coffee, soups, artificial beverages, soft-drinks, cookies and snacks since these are what customers prefer.  Her previous loan had a positive effect in that it gave her and her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy instant coffee, soup, artificial beverages and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Tunas Mekar Asih Group

texts.en: To support her business, Ni Ketut and the Tunas Mekar Asih group decided to continue to borrow a loan. The members will use the loan to buy piglets and feed and to renovate their barn. Ni Ketut will use the loan to purchase only piglets. She purchased  feed with the profit from the last period. From her 1,5M IDR portion of the loan, she can purchase three superior piglets. Beside superior piglets, she also has local pigs for pigroll. She hopes the pigs can grow healthy and she can sell them for a high price.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Sari Madu Group

texts.en:
Sari Madu group received a second loan for 22.5M IDR. Nothing has changed in the membership and composition of the board. The loan in this period is being used to buy piglets and sows.

Ni Ketut, head of the group, is using her loan to buy a sow. She plans to keep the sow and become a piglet seller. Currently the price is quite expensive for piglets at  Rp 475,000 per piglet. Ni Ketut has a dream that this business will become a major source of family income.

loans.use: To buy a sow

loans.name: Recha

texts.en:
Recha is a married man.  He has a son who is 4 years old.  He describes himself to be diligent. 

Recha operates a retail store where he sells items such as sugar, snacks, salt, flour, detergents like Omo, drinking chocolate, etc.  He has been involved in this business for 10 years.  His business is located within a busy market and his primary customers are local residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more household goods to sell.  His business goal is to run a wholesale supermarket within five years.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell.

loans.name: Noutin Célestin

texts.fr: Noutin Célestin est âgé de 26 ans et vit au Bénin. Noutin Célestin a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Noutin Célestin est marié à Emilienne. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge dont deux représentent leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Noutin Célestin vit ensemble sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Noutin Célestin a appris le bobinage, activité qu’il exerce depuis cinq ans dans sa région et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Parallèlement à cette activité, Noutin Célestin vend des noix de palme dans sa région. Noutin Célestin s’approvisionne dans sa région. Grâce au revenu que lui génèrent ses activités, Noutin Célestin contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Noutin Célestin sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts reçus par Noutin Célestin ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Noutin Célestin is 26 years old and lives in Bénin. He attended primary school. He is married to a woman named Emilienne, and the couple have three dependent children in their care, two of whom are their own. All three children go to school. Noutin Célestin lives with his wife and children, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

To support his family, Noutin Célestin learned the trade of spooling. He has been practicing this activity locally for five years, and it brings in substantial income. As a sideline, he sells palm nuts in his region. He buys his stock locally. The revenue earned through his activities allows Noutin Célestin to contribute to the various household expenses. 

Eager to meet the needs of a growing customer base, Noutin Célestin is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. Both previous loans were repaid without incident.

loans.use: to buy spooling wire and palm nuts.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman.  She has two children, three and four years of age.  She describes herself to be optimistic. 

Lilian operates a tailoring shop where she sells dresses, trousers, etc.  She has been involved in this business for five years.  Her business is located near a busy market and her primary customers are local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. 

She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy material to make school uniforms to sell. Her business goal is to run several similar retail tailoring shops within five years.

loans.use: to buy material to make school uniforms to sell.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 58-year-old married woman. She has 6 children who range in age from 25 years to 37 years. She describes herself as optimistic. 

Annah operates a retail store where she sells eggs and charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. 

Annah will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase eggs and charcoal. Annah's dream and business goal is to be a supplier of charcoal and eggs within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and trays of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a married woman with two children who are still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of availability of materials for her tailoring business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for resale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 36-year-old woman. She has two children with ages ranging from five to six years old. She describes herself as loving what she does. She operates a grocery store where she sells mangoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within a busy and conducive market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more mangoes for selling. Her business goal is to be selling a variety of fruits at wholesale within five years.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes to sell

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Aurelia has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Aurelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Aurelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Jonah has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for 25,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

Jonah has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Emma has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 38-year-old married man. He has 2 children who range in age from 5 years to 8 years. He describes himself as determined. 

John operates a grocery store where he sells fruits such as watermelons, mangoes, oranges, etc. He has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located within a busy and viable market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. 

John will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more fruits to sell. His business goal is to be a supplier of fruits within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Elsa is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She also provides computer game services. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Elsa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

loans.name: Norboi

texts.ru: Норбой женат, имеет 4 детей. Он разводит коров и коз. Раньше он работал на заводе, но после сокращения он остался без работы. В настоящий момент он не работает, его жена домохозяйка. Его жена помогает ухаживать за скотом. Он получил кредит для покупки коз и овец. Норбой купит скот и отправит со стадом на пастбище, для увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en: Norboi is married and has four children. He breeds cows and goats. He used to work on the factory before, but after downsizing he was left without work. At this time he does not work, his wife is a homemaker. His wife helps him to look after the cattle. He received the loan to buy goats and sheep. Norboi will buy the cattle and send it off with the herd to the pastures to increase the headcount of livestock.

loans.use: purchase of livestock.

loans.name: Susana Zoila

texts.es:
Susana, es una mujer emprendedora, que a sus 52 años se despierta muy temprano con la finalidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y mejorar constantemente como mujer empresaria. Ella vive sola, debido a que sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y por ende independiente, desde hace ya muchos años es madre soltera, lo que la ha fortalecido cada vez más, con el fin de mejorar su vida y la de sus hijos en ese entonces. 

Susana, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa, lucha diariamente con el fin de mejorar la variedad de sus productos a sus clientes, con el fin de que los mismos se sientan satisfechos con las compras que estos realicen. Ella se levanta muy temprano, con el fin de que a las 7 de la mañana ya se encuentre en la calle visitando a sus clientes para poder incrementar el nivel de sus ventas.

Con la ayuda de los prestamistas Kiva, Susana podrá realizar la compra de algunos productos de belleza (Collares, Aretes, Perfumes,etc.) y prendas de vestir (Polos, Shorts, Pantalones, etc.), lo que la ayudará a que sus clientes le compren más, debido a que ofrecerá nuevos modelos y variedad de productos. Ella está muy contenta por el apoyo que le estamos brindando, ya que está segura de que mejorará sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá cumplir su gran sueño “Construir su casa de material noble”, debido a que los frecuentes sismos y lluvias, le impiden sentirse segura en la vivienda que tiene.
texts.en:
Susana is an entrepreneurial woman that at 52 years old wakes up very early with the purpose of improving  her quality of life and get better as a business woman.  She lives on her own because her children are adults and therefore independent, she became a single mother many years ago, which has made her stronger to have a better life for her and her children since then.
 
Susana sells beauty products and clothes, she works daily to offer a variety of products to her clients, with the purpose of making them feel satisfied with the purchases they make.  She gets up very early so that at 7 AM she is out on the streets visiting clients to increase her sales level.

With the help of Kiva borrowers, Susana will be able to purchase some beauty products (necklaces, earrings, perfumes, etc.)  and clothing (polo shirts, shorts, pants, etc.) which will help get her clients buy more, because she will offer new models and a variety of products.

She is very happy for the support provided and is sure that her income will increase and she will be able to fulfill her dream: "To build a house made with quality construction materials" because due to the frequent earthquakes and rain, she doesn't feel safe in the house she currently has.

loans.use: to buy beauty products (necklaces, earrings, perfumes, etc.)  and clothing (polo shirts, shorts, pants, etc.)

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra Elizabeth tiene 32 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 6 años de edad en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

Sandra  tiene un centro de cómputo y es digitadora.  Solicita el crédito para comprar un computador. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá realizar la compra que le ayudará a incrementar el negocio.

La compra la realizará en Guaranda. El sueño es poder mejorar  la vivienda. El desafío al que se enfrenta es que el hijo culmine los estudios. En el tiempo libre le gusta caminar.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth is 32, married and has a son, she lives with her husband and their six year old son in Chimbo, Province of Bolivar.

Sandra has a computer center and also does data entry.  She requests the loan to buy a computer.  With the help from the loan she will be able to make the purchase she needs which will help to do more business.

She will make the purchase in Guaranda. Her dream is to improve her home, the challenge she faces is to help her son finish his studies.  She enjoys walking during her free time.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from three to five years. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as mangoes, carrots, kale, onions, tomatoes etc. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell. Her business goal is to venture into running a shopping mall within five years.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Elizabeth has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. 

She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Analisa has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Analisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Analisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children.
 
Mercedita is providing motorcycle with sidecar service with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Mercedita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mercedita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline for the services

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Luzviminda has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. Luzviminda requested a loan for 17,000 PHP to buy more stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Luzviminda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Roberto is a fisherman and also sells caught fish to the public. He has had this business for ten years. He has requested a loan for 14,000 PHP to buy materials needed for the maintenance of the fishing boat.

Roberto has been a member of HSPFI for since 2010.  In the future, Roberto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the maintenance of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 44 years old and married with eight children.

Marina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Marina has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 25 years and earns additional income from making fish nets.

Marina aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a married woman. She has five children ranging from 10 to 29 years old. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a conducive business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation of milk to customers. She will use the KES 5,000 loan to purchase cow's feed. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy cow's feed.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan quiere invertir nuevamente en el negocio de la ganadería solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de una vaca y dos cerdos, los cuales espera a futuro obtener ganancias de ellos.
El considera que a crecido con su hato ganadero, que su experiencia con el prestamo anterior le ayudo para realizar la siembra y comprarse algunos animales, esto le ha ayudado a mejorar también las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan wants to invest again in the livestock business requesting a new loan to buy a cow and two pigs, from which he hopes to obtain profit in the future.

He considers that he has grown with his ranch and that his experience with the previous loan helped him with his crops and to buy some livestock, this has helped him improve the life conditions of his family as well.

loans.use: to buy a cow and two pigs.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Progreso De Santa Cruz Group

texts.es: Un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, trabajadoras y unidas, así está conformada  el grupo  de "Progreso de SAnta Cruz", integrada por 10 personas,  sobresalen grandes mujeres, cada una con una historia en particular una de ellas es la señora Elena Margarita de 45 años de edad,  desde pequeña vivió rodeada de ejemplos y coraje que la animaron a emprender el negocio de Productos de belleza ya con 3 años en el negocio a podido dar lo mejor a sus 3 hijos y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar con grandes sueños y metas por cumplir  piensa en el futuro poner un local para internet y con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en comprar productos belleza.
texts.en: A group of entrepreneurial, hardworking and united women, that's how the group "Progreso de Santa Cruz" is formed; it has 10 members, great women that stand out, each of them with a personal story to tell, one of them is Elena Margarita who is 45 years old, since she was young she was surrounded by examples of courage that pushed her to start the business of selling beauty products, with three years in the business she has been able to provide the best she can to her three children and help her husband with the home expenses, with big dreams and goals to achieve she thinks that in the future she will open an Internet café. The new loan will be invested to buy beauty products.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Roxana Emperatriz

texts.es:
Roxana, quiere invertir nuevamente en su negocio, por lo que solicita el préstamo para la compra de verduras frescas tomates, cebollas, papas, repollo y frutas como las sandias, las piñas, las papayas para surtir el negocio y ofrecer a la clientela mayor diversidad.
Ella considera que ha tenido un efecto positivo en el negocio con el préstamo anterior mejorando las circunstancias familiares y desarrollándose en el comercio.
texts.en:
Roxana wants to invest again in her business and she requests a loan to buy fresh vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cabbage and fruits such as watermelons, pineapples and papayas to stock the business and offer more variety to her clients.
She thinks the previous loan had a positive effect in the business by developing in the market  and improving the family situation.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cabbages, watermelons, pineapples and papayas

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, necesita fortalecer su negocio de productos básicos para eso necesita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de frijoles, maíz, arroz, azúcar para diversificar los productos para la clientela. 
El efecto que Juan ha tenido con el prestamo anterior ha sido positivo, ya que ha crecido en su tienda y le ha ayudado también a su familia, de las ganancias obtenidas logro pagar las cuotas y cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Juan needs to strengthen his business with basic products.  To do so he needs a new loan to buy beans, corn, rice, and sugar.  He will do this to have a variety of products for his customers.

The results that Juan has had with his previous loan have been positive.  His store has grown, and it has also helped his family.  With the income he got he managed to make his payments and cover the household necessities.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is 35 years old and married with two children.

Marisol works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Marisol has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and earns an additional income from rice milling and food vending.

Marisol aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en: Merlina is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 4 years, Merlina has operated a shop that sells rice per kilogram. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy a sack of rice to sell. Merlina has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Merlina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice to sell

loans.name: Gigi

texts.en: This time, for her 10th cycle loan, Gigi is borrowing PHP 22,000 to fund her general store. This business was previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide Gigi and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
As a married mother of 7 children, Leonarda works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water. Leonarda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.

Leonarda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Comerciantes De San Juan Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Comerciantes de san Juan  esta  integrado por nueve personas indígenas  humildes de  un pueblo marginado  llamado Santiaguito donde hay muchos árboles verde y la mayoría de la gente viste de huipil y no se cubren los pechos  la mayoría de los hombres de esta comunidad se dedica a la  siembra de maíz.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Águeda  de 31 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos y de pescado desde hace tres años, nos cuenta que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es pelar los pollos y limpiar  los pescados.
Ella nos cuenta que sale a vender a las casas de  su comunidad  sus pollos y pescado en las mañanas y en las tardes.
Nos dice que es viuda y tiene la cantidad de cinco hijos: Aurelio, Jose Maria, Liliana  e Isabel ellos son su mejor tesoro, ellos son su inspiración y sus fuerzas para salir adelante,  uno de sus sueños es darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más pollos y pescado para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo  nos dice lo que mas le deja  ganancias es el pollo ya que les gusta mucho a   sus paisanos.
Nos cuenta una de sus experiencias: Lo que primero empezó a vender  es pollos compro pocos pollos y salía a vender a las casas  y con las ganancias compro pescado  y dejo de vender pollos pero gracias al apoyo de fundacion compro mas pollos y pescado para la venta ya que también  el pescado le deja buenas ganancias pero no mas que el pollo, nos dice que esta contenta por tener sus dos negocios  ya que con esas ganancias ayuda  a sus hijos en su educación.
Esta muy agradecida con fundacion por ayudar a la gente indígena y buena.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Carmelita –quien se dedica a la venta de carne de res.
Pablo-quien se dedica a la venta de carne de res.
Julia-quien se dedica a la venta de pollo.
Margarita-quien se dedica a la venta ropa bordada.
Alicia-quien se dedica a la venta de pan.
Sonia-quien se dedica a la venta de ladrillos.
Marcelino-quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Edith-quien se dedica a la venta de ladrillos.

Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudar a la gente buena con deseos de superarse y salir adelante  y cumplir sus sueños  ya que también la gente de pueblo y pobre tiene sueños e ilusiones.
texts.en:
This group is called "Comerciantes de San Juan" and is made up of nine humble, indigenous people from a marginalized town named Santiaguito.  There are many green trees there, and the majority of people dress in "huipiles" [traditional embroidered dresses] and do not cover their breasts.  The majority of men in the community make a living by harvesting corn.

One of the members of the group is señora Águeda, who is 31.  She has sold chickens and fish for 3 years.  What she likes most about her job is plucking the chickens and cleaning the fish.  She tells us that she goes out to sell them to the houses in the community in the mornings and afternoons.

She tells us that she is a widow and has 5 children:  Aurelio, Jose, Maria, Liliana, and Isabel, who are her biggest treasures.  They are her inspiration and strength for getting ahead.  One of her dreams is to give her children a better future.

She asked for the loan to buy more chickens and fish to sell wholesale and retail.  She tells us that selling chickens is the most profitable because it's what her compatriots like a lot.

She tells us about one of her experiences:  what she first started to sell was chickens, she bought them little by little and went out to sell them to houses.  With her profits, she bought fish and stopped selling chickens.  But thanks to the support of the foundation, she bought more chickens and fish to sell.  Selling fish also makes good profits for her, but not more than the chickens.  She tells us that she is happy to have two businesses since these profits help her children with their education.

She is very grateful to the foundation for helping good and indigenous people.

The other members of the group are:

Carmelita – who sells beef
Pablo - who sells beef
Julia - who sells chicken
Margarita - who sells embroidered clothing
Alicia - who sells bread
Sonia - who sells bricks
Marcelino - who sells Mexican comfort food
Edith - who sells bricks.

She is thankful to the foundation for helping good people who have the desire to improve themselves, get ahead, and fulfill their dreams.  Common and poor people also have hopes and dreams.

loans.use: to buy chickens and fish.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 20 years, she has owned rental houses. Tenants are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by tenants. Zainabu also operates a charcoal selling business, which earns her another source of income. Zainabu dreams of expanding and putting up a permanent house in the future. 

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to renovate her house and purchase cement, sand and timber. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To  purchase cement, sand and timber.to renovate her house

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en: Ma. Nancy is now borrowing PHP 21,000 to fund her fish vending business, which was previously funded through Kiva's partner, NWTF. The business continues to provide Ma. Nancy's family with income that is improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her food stall

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en: For her 8th cycle loan, Crescencia is borrowing PHP 21,000 to fund her general store. This business was previously funded through NWTF and Kiva, and it continues to provide Crescencia and her family with an increased income and an improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy items such as biscuits and groceries

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old.  She is married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has a poultry-supplies business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy more supplies of feed and vitamins.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Webster

texts.en:
Webster is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with one child. 

Webster has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and especially beverages. He has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

Webster has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 38 years old and married with two children who currently go to school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rodelyn runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as snack food, canned goods, body lotion, and other groceries. She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock of items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Rodelyn would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Crysten

texts.en: Crysten, 29 years old, is married and has one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Crysten has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store. Crysten has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita, 38 years old, is married and has 6 children, four of them in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

For the past 2 years, Mercedita has operated a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks and beverages. Mercedita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store. Mercedita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a single man who lives in a family house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, he has operated a retail shop business, selling items to his neighbours and passersby. He also does farming as his other source of income. Sammy faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. 

With the KES 20,000 he wants to pay school fees for his young sibling who attends school. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his young sibling who attends school.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is 58 years old and has 3 children. Demetria is married and has 1 child who is in school.

Demetria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Demetria has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Demetria would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gears and other equipment. She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 42 years old, a married man who has three children who live together in Taiz, Yemen. He started his business by buying a small Xerox machine then he opened a small bookshop. He has lots of time to dedicate to his business and many people prefer his business because he is honest and hard-working. He has many ideas for his business that he’s been implementing little by little. He’s been able to keep his business active for many years. 

Mohammed is a very dignified, confident man and his customers give him good references. Lately, Mohammed has been thinking about stocking his store with a bigger variety of products in order to attract more customers and fill demands. This idea was the impetus to request a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy a variety of products like document paper, books and other articles that would bring in customers. He hopes to have big stationery shop thus  improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products like document paper, books and other items for his business.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. For the past 2 years, Marlyn has operated a sari-sari (variety) store, buying and selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Marlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila, 41 years old,  is married and has 7 children, 4 of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Sheila has operated a sari-sari store business in the Philippines for 6 years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items such as snack foods, eggs, sugar, detergent, etc. Sheila would like to save enough to maintain her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more items such as snack foods, eggs, sugar, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.en: Paulino, 31 years old, is married and lives in the Philippines. For the past 5 years, he has operated a DVD shop that sells and rents DVD movies and television series. Paulino has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of DVDs to rent. Paulino has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of DVDs to rent

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: This time, for her 8th cycle loan, Lourdes is borrowing PHP 12,000 to fund her general store business.  This business was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. Erlinda has a food/retail shop and sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee, a 47-year-old married mother of six, has been working hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines for the last five years. She also earns an income from retailing rice and feeds.

Having borrowed and repaid 23 previous loans from NWTF, Haydee is requesting a new one for PHP 17000 to buy more store stocks to sell. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more store stocks to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. Rosalina has a shop where she sells fish like trout & sardines. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of fish to sell.

Rosalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rosalina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Welardo

texts.en:
Welardo is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 8 children. Welardo is fishing & selling caught fish in the community. He has had this business for 3 years. He has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy materials needed for the maintenance of the fishing boat.

Welardo has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011. In the future, Welardo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the maintenance of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has 1 child. 

Cecilia has a food/retail shop (sari-sari store) from which she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Cecilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Cecilia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Lovely Rose Rea

texts.en:
Lovely Rose Rea is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has 1 child. Lovely Rose Rea has a food shop where she sells snacks like kikiam, tempura, squid roll & fish-ball. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for 17,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for selling snacks.

Lovely Rose Rea has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Lovely Rose Rea hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for selling snacks.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. Florencia has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands like afritada, fried fish & pancit bihon. She has had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands to sell.

Florencia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Florencia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Gloria has a shop where she makes & sells home-made sausage like longganisa & chorizzo. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made sausage.

Gloria has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made sausage

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.en:
Purificacion is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Purificacion has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Purificacion has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Purificacion hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Carolina has a shop that sells different varieties of dried fish per kilogram. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of dried fish to sell.

Carolina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Carolina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a 70-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 29 years to 42 years. He describes himself to be intelligent and an honest man. He operates a retail store where he sells household products such as sugar, salt, baking flour, tea leaves etc. He has been involved in this business for 12 years and employs one staff member. 

Stanley's business is located in a competitive business area and his primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more household products. His business goal is to run a bigger wholesale/retail shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. For the past 15 years, Anita has operated a sari-sari (variety) store, buying and selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Anita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Zuura

texts.en: Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Zuura obtain her first Kiva loan, which was used as intended and repaid. She was able to increase her herd and raise her sales of milk and meat products. Now Zuura has applied for a loan of 40,000 KGS for broadening her business by purchasing sugar beet seeds.

loans.use: To purchase seeds

loans.name: Ma. Roquesa

texts.en: Ma. Roquesa is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 3 years, Ma. Roquesa has operated a shop, selling clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock from Natasha and Avon to sell. Ma. Roquesa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from Natasha and Avon to sell

loans.name: Nenen

texts.en: Nenen is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. For the past 5 years, Nenen has operated a shop that sells a variety of dried fish per kilogram. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of dried fish to sell. Nenen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 7 children. For the past 10 years, Norma has operated a shop, buying and selling generic medicines or drugs and other food supplements. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of generic medicines to sell. Norma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of generic medicines to sell

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. Ginalyn has a food/retail shop (sari-sari store) from which she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 21,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ginalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ginalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en: Florah is a 28 year old married woman. She has 2 children, ages ranging from 2 years to 6 years. She describes herself to be aggressive and determined. She operates a grocery store where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a busy town and her primary customers are butcher men and farmers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to expand the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase bananas to sell. Her business goal is to own a bigger grocery store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a vehicle to aid in distributing fruits to customers.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Juvy operates a pigpen, selling grown & matured pigs. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to purchase animal feeds for the pigs.

Juvy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Juvy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Sonnie

texts.en:
Sonnie lives in compound 3. She is 39 years old, married and has two children, ages 5 and 14, who are attending school. Her husband is a security guard. For the past 9 years she has been running a drugstore in her community where she sells many drugs likes paracetamol, cough syrup, and other drugs that are good for health, especially for children.

Some challenges she faces are that she doesn't have enough drugs in her drugstore. There are many sellers of drugs in her community since the town (compound 3) is far from the capital city. She learned this way of selling from her husband and she is trained as well. She is requesting a loan to buy more drugs (paracetamol, cough syrup, and other drugs) for her business. She hope to build another shop and to educate her children to the higher level in school.

loans.use: to buy more drugs (paracetamol, cough syrup, and other drugs) for her business.

loans.name: Mellie

texts.en:
Mellie is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Mellie has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands like chicken & pork adobo, caldereta & afritada. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Mellie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Mellie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Jonaly

texts.en:
Jonaly is 38 years old and has 7 children. She is married and 5 of her children are in school. Jonaly is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jonaly has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs to sell.

Jonaly has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jonaly would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has four sons. She describes herself to be diligent. She operates a retail store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs one staff member. Her business is located near a shopping centre and her primary customers are retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to expand the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase charcoal for sale. Lucy's dream and  business goal is to be a major supplier of charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anie Khemper

texts.en:
Anie Khemper is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Anie Khemper has a shop that sells a variety of fish like trout, sardines & mackerel per kilogram. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of fish to sell.

Anie Khemper has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Anie Khemper hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Angelina has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. Her husband provides motorcycle transport services. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Angelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Angelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 37 year old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail store where he provides repairing services for television, radios, battery charging, iron boxes, mobile phones etc. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located within a busy shopping market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase a phone charger and batteries. His business goal is to run several similar electronics repairing shops within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy a phone charger and batteries.

loans.name: Julinda

texts.en:
