Julinda is 61 years old. She is married and has 11 children. With 2 children in school, Julinda works very hard to provide for them.

Julinda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. Julinda has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, sugar, milk, shampoo, noodles, etc.

In the future, Julinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Jovie has a food/retail shop (sari-sari store) where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Jovie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jovie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Marietta has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from a restaurant and buying and selling charcoal and firewood.

Marietta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie, 49 years old, is married and has 6 children. Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store for 11 years and also earns income from a coffee shop. Rosemarie has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Rosemarie has already borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. Sonia has been in this business for 4 years, and earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear items.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. For the past 7 years, Cecilia has operated a sari-sari (variety) store, buying and selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Cecilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Yolanda has been in this business for 4 years, and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 43 years old, married and has 2 children. Liberty is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Liberty has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pig.

Liberty has been fattening pigs for 8 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Liberty would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 62 years old, married and has 4 children who are in school. Alicia is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs, in the Philippines. Alicia has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pig.

Alicia has been fattening pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 63 years old, married and has 2 children who are in school. Teresita is in the agricultural business, farming rice, in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Teresita has been farming rice for 14 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farming. In the future, Teresita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 73 years old and married. She has 7 children. Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Emma has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 28 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Emma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with two children. 

Asuncion has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Asuncion has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Asuncion hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora, 61 years old, is a widow with 9 children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 8 years, Leonora has operated a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

Leonora has already borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF. She earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Leonora hopes to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 50 years old and has 8 children. Merlyn is widowed and has 3 children who are in school. Merlyn is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs, in the Philippines. Merlyn has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlyn has been fattening pigs for 14 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 26 years old and has 3 children. She is married and has 2 children who are in school. Elsie is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy livestock to sell.

Elsie has been buying and selling livestock for 6 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Elsie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock to sell.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita works hard to support her family. Florita is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Florita has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of clothes to sell.

Florita has been in this business for 2 years now. In the future, Florita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 49 years old and married. She has 6 children. With 2 children in school, Leticia works very hard to provide for them. Leticia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Leticia has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, biscuits, candies, etc. In the future Leticia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motor vehicle repair tools.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 46 years old and married. She has five children. Azucena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a Sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Azucena has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from hog raising.

Azucena aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta, 60 years old, is married and has ten children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 3 years, Enriqueta has operated a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as soft drinks, soap, sugar, and other groceries to sell in her store.

Enriqueta has already borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF. She earns additional income from fish vending. Enriqueta hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as soft drinks, soap, sugar, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mervie

texts.en:
Mervie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store. Mervie has been in this business for 5 years, and she earns additional income from e-loading and raising livestock.

Mervie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Tarcesia

texts.en: Tarcesia is married and works hard to support her family. She has operated an abaca weaving business in the Philippines for 25 years. Tarcesia has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy abaca for her business. She also earns additional income from food vending. Tarcesia would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca for her business.

loans.name: Buenerge

texts.es:
Buenerge está solicitando un nuevo préstamo ya que necesita realizar el pago del alquiler del terreno en el cual cultivara maíz y frijol esto le ayudara a tener seguridad en su trabajo agrícola.
El manifiesto haber tenido una gran ayuda con el préstamo anterior porque logro comprar los insumos necesarios para el cultivo de maíz y frijol ayudándole a proveer a su familia estos alimentos y a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Buenerge is requesting a new loan because he needs to pay for land that he rents on which he grows corn and beans.  This will help him have security in his agricultural work.

He expressed that it was a great help to have his previous loan because he was able to buy the necessary supplies to grow corn and beans, helping him provide his family with food and his children with an education.

loans.use: to pay for rented land.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela is married and works hard to support her family. She has operated a clothing sales business in the Philippines for 20 years. Estela has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items such as pants, slippers and other ready-to-wear clothing. Estela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items such as pants, slippers and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Jumaa

texts.en: Jumaa is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to expand his business, purchase a shaving machine and a battery charger for charging mobile phones. Thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving him an opportunity to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new hair shaving machine and a battery charger for mobile phones..

loans.name: Paz

texts.en: This time, for her 24th cycle loan, Paz is borrowing PHP 16,000 to fund her clothing sales business.  This business was previously funded through Kiva partner, NWTF, and continues to provide her family with income that improves their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 33 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

Jeanette is in the aquaculture business culturing seaweeds in the Philippines. Jeanette requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials like bamboo, plastic wire, etc.

Jeanette has been in business for two years now and has borrowed one time from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jeanette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials like bamboo, plastic wire, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a  Kiva borrower who has 4 children with ages ranging from 18  to 28. She describes herself as honest. For the past 15 years, Grace has operated an estate where she provides rental houses services. Her business is located in a viable business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expanding the business. Grace will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay for the renovation of her rental houses. Grace's dream and business goal is to be the best rental houses service provider.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of rental houses.

loans.name: Gladys Mercedes

texts.es:
GLADYS MERCEDES,  tiene 46 años de edad,  es soltera,  tiene 3 hijos de las edades de 25,23 y  22  años  vive con ellos, en el  cantón Montalvo, trabajan todos para poder salir adelante.

La VRC  San Joaquín  se   encuentra a 15  minutos  de la oficina Montalvo, está conformada por 12 socios.

 GLADYS MERCEDES se dedica a la venta de comida y tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres.

Solicita el crédito para comprar azucar, arroz, aceite, manteca vegetal pata poder incrementar el negocio. Las compras y las ventas lo hacen en Montalvo de manera  semanal.

El sueño es incrementar su negocio,  seguir trabajando junto a su familia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta  es que a veces no se vende los víveres, ni las comidas ni para recuperar lo invertido.
En el tiempo libre le gusta arreglar su casa, sobre todo lavar la ropa de sus hijos.
texts.en: Gladys Merceds is 46 and single.  She has 3 children, who are 25, 23, and 22.  She lives with them in the canton of Montalvo.  All of them work to get ahead.  The San Joaquín communal bank is located 15 minutes from the Montalvo office and is made up of 12 members.  Gladys Mercedes makes a living by selling food, and she has a small general store.  She is requesting the loan to buy sugar, rice, oil, and vegetable oil to be able to increase her sales and to keep working along with her family.  The challenges that she faces is sometimes not selling products or food to recover her investment.  In her free time, she likes to clean house, and her favorite chore is washing her children's clothes.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, and vegetable oil to be able to increase her sales.

loans.name: Mayrose

texts.en:
Mayrose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pillow-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her pillow-making business.

Mayrose has been in this business for three years. Mayrose earns more income from her sari-sari store and from fish vending.

Mayrose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with five children. 

Rosa has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. 

She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Rosa has been a member of HSPFI since 2007.  In the future, Rosa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 67 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Yolanda runs a business buying and selling feed and veterinary products in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Yolanda has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Yolanda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Emily S.

texts.en: Emily live in Compound #3, is 39 years old, married, and has eight children between the ages of 8 and 21. Her husband works as a secretary. For seven years now, she has been operating a drugstore in her community. She enjoys her business because it makes her popular and people give her respect in her community. She is requesting a loan to buy more medicines (paracetamol, cough syrup, and others items) for her business. In the near future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more medicines to sell at her pharmacy

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is a  Kiva borrower who has 2 children, 6 and 9 years old. She describes herself as an ambitious woman. Winfred operates a farm and a retail shop where she sells farm produce and household goods. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. It is located in a conducive business environment and her primary customers are local residents. Winfred's biggest business challenge is high transportation costs. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy household goods to sell. Winfred's dream and business goal is to venture into the transportation industry within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy household goods.

loans.name: Crepi Group

texts.fr: CREPI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à un même collectif d'artisans. Le représentant du groupe, Augustin (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 30 ans. Augustin est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Mariette. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge dont deux constituent leurs propres enfants et dont certains sont scolarisés. Augustin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Augustin a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire et a appris ensuite la soudure. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Augustin exerce depuis sept ans dans sa région, la soudure, activité qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Augustin s’approvisionne au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue de mieux équiper son atelier de soudure par l'acquisition d'un alternateur, Augustin sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe CREPI. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les deux prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
CREPI is a group of three persons whose members belong to the same collective of craftsmen. The group's representative, Augustin (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 30 years old. Augustin is married to a retailer named Mariette. They have five children to support. Two of the children are their own, and some of them are in school. Augustin lives together with his wife and children. The couple jointly ensure the various household expenses are covered. 

Augustin dropped out of primary school and then learned how to weld. To cope with his various expenses, he has been welding for seven years in this region. It is a business that brings in non-negligible revenues. He gets his supplies from Nigeria. 

Seeking to satisfy his customers and having the aim of better equipping his welding shop by acquiring a generator, Augustin, along with the other members of the group CREPI, is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. This loan will be used to respond better to the demands of their customers and to make more profit. The [first] two loans were paid back.

loans.use: to buy a generator

loans.name: Jacinto Angel

texts.es:
JACINTO ANGEL, de 52 años de edad,  es casado,   vive con su esposa e hijos, tiene tres  de las edades de 22,19 y 12 años, en el Recinto San Joaquin, perteneciente al cantón Montalvo.

La VRC  San Joaquín  se   encuentra a 15  minutos  de la oficina Montalvo, está conformada por 12 socios.

 JACINTO ANGELse dedica a la agricultura, cultiva arroz, soya y maíz, además tiene una tienda de venta de víveres.

Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, lìquidos para la maleza, fertilizantes, urea para  mejorar los cultivos.

Las compras y ventas las ejecuta en  Montalvo de manera  semanal. El sueño es incrementar la producción  y poder seguir trabajando, hasta que sus hijos sean profesionales y puedan defenderse por sí solos. 

 Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan  son las plagas que se presentan en los cultivos, la época invernal que a veces es demasiado ocasionando  inundaciones y pérdida total de la producción. 
  
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar ya que el trabajo del campo es agotador.
texts.en: Jacinto Angel is 52 and married.  He lives with his wife and 3 children, who are 22, 19, and 12.  They live in San Joaquin, which belongs to the Montalvo canton.  The San Joaquin communal bank is located 15 minutes from the Montalvo office and is made up of 12 members.  Jacinto Angel makes a living through agriculture and grows rice, soy, and corn.  He also has a general store.  He is requesting a loan to buy supplies, weed killer, fertilizers, and urea to improve his crops.  He makes his purchases and sales in Montalvo on a weekly basis.  His goal is to increase his production and to keep working until his children are professionals and can support themselves.  The challenges he faces are the pests that invade his crops.  The winter season is at times very hard and causes floods and a total loss of production.  In his free time, he likes to rest since working in the fields is exhausting.

loans.use: to buy supplies, weed killer, fertilizers and urea to improve his crops.

loans.name: Jogie

texts.en:
Jogie is 42 years old and married with three children.

Jogie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Jogie has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Jogie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 37 years old and married with two children.

Juliet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Juliet has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from furniture making.

Juliet aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a coconut-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.fr: Pascal est âgé de 43 ans et vit au Bénin. Pascal est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Epiphanie. Pascal a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Le couple a neuf enfants à leur charge dont sept représentent leurs propres enfants et dont certains sont scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Pascal a appris la mécanique et exerce ce métier depuis vingt deux ans. De façon secondaire, Pascal vend des motos usagers dans sa région. Pascal s’approvisionne au Nigeria. Grâce au revenu que lui génère ses activités, Pascal contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Pascal sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement par Pascal a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Pascal is 43 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a retailer named Epiphanie. Pascal halted his studies in primary school. The couple have nine children to support. Seven of the children are their own, and some of them are in school. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered.

To help meet the diverse needs of the family, Pascal learned how to be a mechanic and has been working in this trade for 22 years. On the side, he sells used motorbikes in his region. He gets his supplies from Nigeria. Thanks to the revenues generated by this business, Pascal helps to cover the different family expenses. 

To satisfy his burgeoning customer base, Pascal is requesting a loan from ALIDé for a second time. The loan he previously received was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy tires, motor oil, and used motorbikes

loans.name: Jorge Wilson

texts.es:
JORGE WILSON, de 46 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre tiene dos hijos de 14 y 15 años, vive con su esposa e hijos,  en el Recinto San Joaquín del cantón Montalvo, Provincia de Los Ríos.

La VRC  San Joaquín  se   encuentra a 15  minutos  de la oficina Montalvo, está conformada por 12 socios.

JORGE WILSONse dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de arroz, soya y maíz, con este dinero quiere también arrendar más terreno con la finalidad de obtener más ganancias en la producción de los productos de la costa.

Solicita el crédito para comprar, abonos, insecticidas, herbicidas y líquidos para garantizar su cosecha. Las compras y ventas las realiza en la ciudad de Montalvo de manera semanal.

El sueño es comprar terreno propio, para producir más y construir su vivienda propia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan  son las pérdidas de los cultivos, especialmente por plagas o estación invernal constante.
texts.en: Jorge Wilson is 46.  He lives in a common law marriage and has 2 children, who are 14 and 15.  He lives with his wife and kids in San Joaquín in the Montalvo canton in the Los Ríos province.  The San Joaquín communal bank is located 15 minutes from the Montalvo office.  It is made up of 12 members.  Jorge Wilson makes a living through agriculture and grows rice, soy, and corn.  With this money, he also wants to rent more land with the goal of obtaining more profits from his products.  He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides, and liquids to guarantee his harvest.  He makes his purchases and sales in Montalvo on a weekly basis.  His dream is to buy his own land, to produce more, and to build his own home.  The challenges he faces are losing his crops, especially due to pests or the constant rainy season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, and liquids to guarantee his harvest.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Cristy has a shop where she sells coconuts for copra & bananas by the kilogram. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 17,000 PHP to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

Cristy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cristy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is continuing with his occupation in the auto repair business. David used his first Kiva loan to repair his workshop and also to buy necessary tools for his business. During recent months, Davit has enlarged his workshop and in the photo you can see a newly built wall. This will allow Davit to serve more clients at the same time.

Davit’s two sons now are married and are living separately from the parents. Davit’s only daughter is still a student and Davit continues to pay for her education. 

Davit is asking for a 600,000 AMD loan to buy a diagnostic tester for his business, which will allow him to define a car’s problems more exactly.

loans.use: to buy a diagnostic tester for his business

loans.name: Gouton

texts.fr: Gouton est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Gouton n’a pas trop fréquenté l’école. Gouton est marié à une marchande du nom de Bernadette. Le couple a six enfants à leur charge dont quatre sont leurs propres enfants et dont certains sont scolarisés. Gouton vit ensemble ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre aux divers besoins de la maison, Gouton a appris l'électricité et exerce ce métier depuis vingt cinq ans dans sa région. Gouton s’approvisionne en matériels électriques au Nigeria. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère ce métier, Gouton contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Gouton sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de  ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Gouton ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Gouton is 38 years old and lives in Benin.  He attended school for a very short time only.  He is married to a retailer named Bernadette.  The couple has six children in their care, four of whom are their own children.  Some of the children are in school.  Gouton lives with his wife and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the household expenses.  

In order to provide for his family, Gouton learned the trade of electrician and has been working in this field, in his region, for twenty-five years.  Gouton buys his electrical supplies in Nigeria.  Thanks to the income generated through this activity, he is able to contribute to expenses at home.  

In order to meet the needs of an increasing number of customers, Gouton is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.  His previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies.

loans.name: Celenia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Celenia C. es una mujer esforzada, a pesar de que no ha tenido un apoyo de pareja ha sabido sacar adelante a su hijos desde muy pequeños; hoy en dia continua laborando como conserge en una casa particular, empleo que no le sastiface sus necesidades personales ni la de sus cuatro hijos señalaba la señora. Sin embargo agredece a Dios primeramente y luego a Kiva y Afodenic que han sido los medios para ella poderles brindar a los suyos una vivienda digna. El prestamo que solicita en esta ocasión es para la instalacion de tuberias de aguas negras en su casa de habitacion para lo que utilizara los siguientes materiales de construccion: tubos, cemento, bloques, pegamento, arena piedrin, estribos entre otros; logrando con esta instalacion mejores condiciones de salud para ella y su familia.Su plan a futuro es seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en: Doña Celenia is a hard-working woman.  Despite the fact that she has not had the support of a husband, she has known how to take good care of her children since they were very young.  Today she continues working as a caretaker in a private home, a job that doesn't meet her personal needs or those or her four children.  Nevertheless, she is thankful to God first and then to Kiva and Afodenic, who have been the means for her to be able to offer her family members a decent life.  The loan that she is requesting is to install plumbing for sewage in her home that will need the following construction materials:  pipes, cement, bricks, glue, gravel, joints, etc.  Completing this instalation will give her and her family better health conditions.  Her future plan is to continue improving her home.

loans.use: to install plumbing in her home.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a 50-year old married woman. She has 2 children ranging from 5 years to 6 years. She describes herself as an optimistic woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruit such as oranges, tomatoes, onions and carrots. She has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located at a busy shopping market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruit to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesale supplier of vegetables and fruit to Huruma and Nairobi town within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Kathao

texts.en: Mukila is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 21 to 31 years old. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a farm and a retail store where she sells home products (groceries) such as sugar, salt, etc. In addition, she sells tea. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of home products. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy home products. Her business goal is to have a stable income and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: André

texts.fr: André est âgée de 54 ans et vit au Bénin. André a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. André est marié à une marchande du nom de Thérèse. Le couple a huit enfants dont cinq sont à leur charge et dont certains enfants sont scolarisés. André vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme et assure ensemble avec sa femme les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre à ses divers besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, André a appris le métier de la couture et exerce ce métier depuis près de trente cinq ans dans sa région. Parallèlement a ce métier André vend des motos d’occasion dans sa région. André s’approvisionne au Nigéria. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère ses activités, André contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, André sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement par André ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
André is 54 years old and lives in Benin. He halted his studies in primary school. André is married to a merchant named Thérèse. They have eight children. Five of the children are their own, and some of them are in school. André lives together with this children and wife, and he jointly ensures with her that the diverse household expenses are covered.

To meet his diverse needs and those of his family, André learned how to be sew and has been working in this trade for nearly 35 years in this region. Concurrent to this trade, he sells used motorbikes in his region. He gets his supplies from Nigeria. Thanks to the revenues generated by this business, André helps to cover the different household expenses.

To satisfy his burgeoning customer base, André is requesting a loan from ALIDé for a third time. The two loan he previously received were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is a 36-year-old married man. He has 2 children whose ages range from 4 to 13 years. He describes himself as an honest, efficient and kind man. He operates a grocery store where he sells vegetables and fruit such as oranges, tomatoes, onions and carrots. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located near a viable populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be interruptions by city council. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruit to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will own an estate  and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Jesugnon Group

texts.fr: JESUGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Lydia (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans. Lydia est mariée à un certain Rachidi et a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Lydia vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Lydia vend depuis quinze ans, des produits vivriers à son domicile. Lydia s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité et pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Lydia sollicite à nouveau un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGNON. Les crédits antérieurs consentis ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
JESUGNON is a group made up of three women who are friends.  The group's representative, Lydia (raising her hand in the photo), is 37 years old.  She is married to a man named Rachidi and has three children who all attend school.  She lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses with her husband.

In order to meet her various expenses, Lydia has been selling food products from her home, for fifteen years.  She stocks up at a market in Benin.

In oder to expand her business and to be more competitive on the market, Lydia is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the JESUGNON group.  Previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Octavio Adolfo

texts.es:
OCTAVIO ADOLFO, tiene 46 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos de las edades de 11, 5 y de 2 años,  vive con su esposa e hijos  en  el cantón Montalvo, provincia de Los Ríos.

La VRC  San Joaquín  se   encuentra a 15  minutos  de la oficina Montalvo, está conformada por 12 socios.
Octavio   se dedica a la agricultura; cultiva arroz y soya.

OCTAVIO ADOLFO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y cebada, Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, lìquidos para la maleza, mata montes,  con este dinero  adquirirá semillas de mejor calidad e insumos para mejorar su cosecha. 

Las compras y ventas las realiza de manera mensual en Montalvo, o de acuerdo a la necesidad puede ser diario o semanal.

El sueño es  prosperar   en sus tierras con incremento de productos y así construir una casa más grande  pensando en el futuro de sus hijos.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta  es la pérdida de los cultivos por el mal tiempo o  plagas que aparecen en los cultivos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta leer la biblia, ya que es un hijo de Jesucristo.
texts.en:
Octavio Adolfo is 46 years old, is married, has three children ages 11, 5, and 2 years, and lives with this wife and children in the canton of Montalvo, province of Los Rios.

The communal bank San Joaquin is located 15 minutes from the Montalvo office and has 12 members.

Octavio works in agriculture.  He cultivates rice and soy.  Octavio works in agriculture growing corn and barley.

He is requesting a loan to buy urea, insecticides, herbicides and brush killer.  With this money he will acquire better quality seeds and other supplies to improve his harvest.

He completes his purchases and sales on a monthly basis in Montalvo, or daily or weekly if necessary.  

His dream is to prosper on his land with an increase in products and thus build a larger house, thinking of the future of his children.

The challenges that he confronts are the loss of crops to bad weather or pests that appear on the crops.

In his free time he likes to read the bible, since he is a child of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, herbicides and brush killer.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with two children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the KES 15,000 loan, she wants to renovate her food stall business and purchase furniture. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to renovate her food stall business and purchase furniture.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and brother).  Annet has a business of selling used clothes.  She has been in this business for 3 years, and she works 7 days a week.  Annet sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail. Annet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes.

The main business challenges for Annet include defaulters and the rainy season, which hinders her movements.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to get a permanent business premise.  Annet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Misheck

texts.en: Misheck is a married man. He has 2 children whose ages range from 10 to 15 years. He describes himself as an ambitious man. He operates a retail store where he sells home products  such as sugar, salt and tea leaves. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located at a conducive business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of household goods. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy home products. Misheck's dream and business goal is to expand his business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en: Zam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children are in school. She takes care of additional family members (father and mother). She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She also practices poultry farming from home. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to educate her children up to university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Amous-Sou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AMOUS-SOU est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans la même maison. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ayaba est celle qui à la main levée sur la photo. Ayaba est âgée 39 ans et est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Virgile. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Ayaba n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Ayaba  vend  des du maïs et de l'igname à son domicile depuis vingt ans. Ayaba s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Ayaba sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AMOUS-SOU, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The AMOUS-SOU group consists of five members who live in the same house.  

The group's representative, named Ayaba, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She is 39 years old and married to a welder named Virgile.  The couple has three children, all in school and all their dependents.  Parents and children live together.  

Ayaba has never attended school.  In order to provide for herself and for her children, she has been selling maize and yams, from her home, for twenty years.  She buys her goods at a market in Benin.

In order to meet the needs of her customers, and also to increase her turnover and income, Ayaba is requesting a first loan, together with the other members of the AMOUS-SOU group.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and yams.

loans.name: Sayea

texts.en:
Sayea, 30, lives in compound 3 with her husband and her 4 children between the ages of 12 and 22.  Some of the children are in school.

Sayea's husband is a power operator.  For 10 years, she has been involved in the fish sale business. Her sister taught her this business.  She likes her business because it gives her lots of profit.  She is requesting a loan to buy more fish for her business.  Her plan is to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Allègresse Plus Group

texts.en:
“Allègresse Plus” is a group of 15 owners of small businesses chaired by Rose. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses. They will each use their portion of loan for different purposes.

Rose is a dressmaker who sells clothes in her area.  She became a microentrepreneur in 2009. Her business is located in the eastern area of Kinshasa. Having received already two loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them, she intends to use this loan to buy fabrics to sew clothes and sell them at a profit in order to increase her working capital. Currently she earns a profit of $50 per week. Rose is 62 years old, married and the mother of four children aged between 22 and 30. Two of them attend school. Her dream is to someday open a sewing workshop in her area located east of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to sew clothes and resell them in order to increase her working capital

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fanny Mabel

texts.es:
Fany se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo ya que desea comprar productos para la venta de panes, hamburguesas y refresco, comprara salchicha, aderezos, condimento, carne, pan, gaseosas y otros más productos que son necesarios para la venta.
Ella considera que su negocio se ha fortalecido manteniendo siempre disponible los productos para los clientes esto le ha dado mayor seguridad y solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Fanny decided to take a new loan because she wants to buy products for selling bread, hamburgers, and soft drinks. She will will buy sausages, seasonings, condiments, meat, bread, sodas, and other products that are needed for her sales.

Fanny believes her business has been strengthened because she always keeps products available for her customers. This has given her greater security and financial profitability.

loans.use: to buy sausages, seasonings, condiments, meat, bread, sodas, and other supplies.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa es una mujer de 41 años de edad, conviviente y con un hijo a cargo. Vive en casa propia, ubicada en el caserío Ayar Cachi e el distrito de Tambogrande. Vive en la parte rural de la zona, pero cuenta con servicio de electricidad.
La actividad que realiza Carmen Rosa consiste en la crianza  de animales menores, como aves de corral y ovinos, los cuales alimenta y una vez alcanzados el peso y talla ideal, los comercializa en los caseríos cercanos y el mercado local. Aparte, vende productos naturales, con clientela fija establecida.
El monto del préstamo solicitado asciende a 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales serán destinados a la compra de más animales para comercializar y también se comprará comida para que puedan crecer, venderse luego y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a 41-year-old woman, lives with a common law partner and their son.  They live in a house they own, located in the Ayar Cachi neighborhood in the district of Tambogrande.  She lives in a rural area of that zone but she has electricity service.
Carmen Rosa's activity is raising small livestock, such as poultry and sheep, which she feeds and once they reach the ideal size and weight, she sells them to houses that are close by and at the local market.  In addition, she sells natural products and has an established client base.  The amount requested is 1,000 new soles, which she will use to buy livestock and feed so they can grow and be sold later and this way improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed to raise and sell.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Emilia works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a variety store. Emilia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy utensils, kitchenware, and ingredients for her restaurant business.

Emilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy utensils, kitchenware, and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a widowed woman with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past nine years, she has operated a mat weaving and selling business, selling at retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale to sell her mats in the future.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase weaving materials and to pay school fees for her children who attend school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials and pay school fees.

loans.name: Mahukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUKPEGO est composé de trois  personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Kouassialé Emilie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Kouassialé Emilie est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un certain Jean Marc. Kouassialé Emilie vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour  y parvenir, Kouassialé Emilie mène comme activité depuis dix ans, la vente d'ustensiles de cuisine, de la farine de manioc et des tissus à son domicile et parfois par le système de distribution. Kouassialé Emilie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Kouassialé Emilie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO, un deuxième crédit. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group MAHUKPEGO comprises three persons who reside in the same district. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, Kouassialé Emilie, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 33 years old and married to a man named Jean Marc. She lives together with her husband and child. The couple have one child who is in school and in their care. 

The diverse household expenses are covered by the couple. To do so, Kouassialé Emilie has had a business for ten years selling kitchen utensils, cassava flour, and cloth out of her home and sometimes via the distribution system. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, Kouassialé Emilie, like the other members of the group MAHUKPEGO, is requesting a second loan. The first loan was repaid.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils, cloth, and cassava flour

loans.name: Mahoussi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUSSI est composé de deux personnes qui vivent dans la même maison. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mahoussi Micheline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mahoussi Micheline est âgée de 64 ans et vit au Bénin. Mahoussi Micheline est mariée à un certain Eugène. Le couple a trois enfants dont un est à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Mahoussi Micheline n’a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Mahoussi Micheline mène comme activité depuis trente ans, la vente de fruits  dans un marché du Benin. Mahoussi Micheline s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mahoussi Micheline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUSSI, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Mahoussi group is composed of two persons living in the same house. It is the third time that the group is seeking financial support from ALIDé, in order to expand their business. The group’s representative, by the name of Mahoussi Micheline, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Mahoussi Micheline is  64 years old and lives in Benin. Her husband’s name is Eugene. They have three children, one of whom is still in their care. Some of the children are  studying. Mahoussi Micheline never attended school. To support herself and her children,  Mahoussi Micheline has been selling fruits at one of the markets of Benin for 30 years. Mahoussi Micheline stocks up in a town in Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand and increasing her sales volume and her revenues, Mahoussi Micheline, on behalf of her group, is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. Their prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fruits [for resale].

loans.name: Alodo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALODO est composé de deux personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Kuassialé Céline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Kuassialé Céline est âgée de 47 ans et vit au Benin. Kuassialé Céline est mariée à un électricien du nom de Henri. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et trois restent à leur charge. Kuassialé Céline vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Les charges familiales sont supportées à la fois par Kuassialé Céline et son mari. Afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille, Kuassialé Céline achète du riz, du maïs et des condiments dans un marché du Bénin, et les revend de façon ambulante mais aussi par le système de distribution. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Kuassialé Céline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALODO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group ALODO comprises two persons who live in the same district. The group's representative, Kuassialé Céline, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 47 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to an electrician named Henri. They have four children, some of whom are in school. Three of the children are still in their care. Kuassialé Céline lives with her children and husband. The family expenses are covered by both her and her husband. 

To support her family, Kuassialé Céline purchases rice, corn, and condiments from a market in Benin and resells them door to door but also via the distribution system. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, Kuassialé Céline, along with the other members of the group ALODO, is requesting a third loan. The first two loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, corn, and condiments

loans.name: Monica Cecibel

texts.es:
Mónica Cecibel, tiene 41 años de edad,  es soltera  vive en Montalvo  con sus padres.

La VRC  San Joaquín  se   encuentra a 15  minutos  de la oficina Montalvo, está conformada por 12 socios.

Mónica Cecibel se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo  de arroz, soya y maíz,además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos de raza.
   
Solicita el crédito para la compra de todos los insumos, urea, insecticidas, ranger, líquidos para la maleza que se necesitan para la siembra y así garantizar su cosecha. 
Las compras y ventas las realiza en la ciudad de Babahoyo y Guayaquil de acuerdo a las necesidades que se presentan.

Su sueño es comprarse un solar para construir su casa y un terreno para dedicarlo a la siembra.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan es a veces la pérdida de las siembras por  presencia de las lluvias y plagas.

Su tiempo libre lo dedica a   la confección de manualidades.
texts.en:
Mónica Cecibel is 41 years old, single, and lives in Montalvo with her parents.

The San Joaquín Communal Bank is located 15 minutes from the Cooperativa San Jose office in Montalvo. The group has 12 members.

Mónica Cecibel is a farmer who grows rice, soybeans, and corn. She also raises chickens and pigs of good breed. Mónica is requesting a loan to buy all of her supplies such as urea, insecticides, Ranger (a brand of herbicide), and liquids for preventing weeds. These items are needed for her planting so that she can promote her harvest. Her purchases and sales are conducted in the cities of Babahoyo and Guayaquil based on what she needs.

Mónica dreams of buying a plot of land for building a house and farmland designated for planting crops. The challenges she faces include the occasional loss of crops as a result of diseases and an abundance of rain.

In her free time, Mónica enjoys making handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, herbicide, and liquids for preventing weeds.

loans.name: Jaqueline De La Paz

texts.es:
Jaqueline,  se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo porque quiere comprar más materiales de cocina para realizar su venta de comida y además de mariscos. Ella comprara aceite, condimentos, carnes, vegetales, pescado, camarones.
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo como el préstamo anterior realizando buenas compras y administrando bien para mejorar la situación económica de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Jaqueline has decided to request a new loan because she wants to buy more kitchen materials to make her food and seafood sales.  She will buy oil, condiments, vegetables, fish, and shrimp.  Her previous loan had a positive effect, and she made good purchases and administered her business well to improve her and her family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy oil, condiments, meat, vegetables, fish, and shrimp.

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en: Hasifa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and all her children are in school. She takes care of additional family members (Father) .She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children up to university level and to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, medication and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother). 

Joyce has a business of selling green bananas. She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 7 days a week.  Joyce sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Joyce has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.  She also generates additional income through selling charcoal. The main business challenges for Joyce include thieves and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to start going to villages for bananas. Joyce lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro es un hombre casado, tiene dos hijos y dedicado a su trabajo. Vive en el distrito de Zaña, donde tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su poblado se caracteriza por desarrollar actividades como la ganadería y la agricultura.
La actividad a la que se dedica Álvaro es a la crianza y venta de animales en su domicilio.Con el crédito comprará más animales para surtir su negocio y su respectiva venta.
Atendiendo la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar,  ampliará su cartera de clientes, contando con clientes nuevos e ingresos adicionales a la familia.
La familia de Alvaro es muy unida, y con el crédito piensa mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Alvaro is a married gentleman who has two children and is dedicated to his work. He lives in the District of Zaña. Alvaro has good personal and work-related references. His village is known for having developed businesses, such as livestock breeding and agriculture. Alvaro's business involves raising and selling animals from his home. With this loan, he will buy more animals to replenish his business and increase his sales.

Alvaro attends to the demand that has not been met in his area and his list of customers is growing. As a result of having more customers, he has more income for his family. Alvaro's family is very close and he believes this loan will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy more animals for his business.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar es un hombre muy trabajador, muy cariñoso con su esposa la cual es su mano derecha y la cual lo acompaña siempre y con sus dos péquenos hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad, por los que da la vida y lucha cada día por darles una mejor calidad de vida; Cesar y su familia viven en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes de nuestro país, el cual son Las Islas Ballestas, y también “El Candelabro de Paracas”. Cesar trabajaba anteriormente como albañil en construcciones, era un trabajo muy duro pero con el cual logro ahorrar y tomo la decisión de comprarse una mototaxi; desde hace 8 años, 8 años en los cuales el se ha dedicado con mucha fuerza y optimismo a su trabajo, sobre todo porque su mejor motivación son sus hijos, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque realiza sus labores con mucho optimismo y sobre todo buen trato a sus clientes.

Cesar está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una puerta para su vehículo, lo que le permitirá tener un vehículo más seguro para transportar a los clientes y tendrán más confianza en usar su servicio, con lo cual seguirá luchando cada día para cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vida”.
texts.en: Cesar is a very hard-working man.  He is very caring with his wife, who is his right hand and is always with him, and also with their two small children, who are 9 and 7.  He fights for them every day to give them a better quality of life.  Cesar and his family live in the city of Pisco, a city that is known for having one of the most important tourist attractions of our country, the Ballestas Islands and also the Candelabra of Paracas.  Cesar used to work in construction.  It was a very hard job, but with what he managed to save, he made the decision to buy a motorcycle rickshaw.  He has had this business for 8 years, and he has dedicated himself to it with a lot of effort and optimism, above all because his best motivation is his children.  He believes his business is going well because he does his work with a lot of optimism and treats his customers well.  Cesar is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help, he will be able to buy a door for his vehicle, which will make it safer to transport his customers, and they will have more confidence in his service.  He will continue fighting every day to fulfill his biggest dream:  "to give his children a good education and a better quality of life."

loans.use: to buy a door for his rickshaw.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella lives in Kampala, Uganda .She is married with seven children and five of her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members .She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last five years .She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a truck, which she can use to deliver her bananas. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Amegnonna Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AMEGNONNA est composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Houévi Irène est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Houévi Irène est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Benin. Houévi Irène est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Simplice. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Houévi Irène vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Houévi Irène supporte ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Pour y parvenir, Houévi Irène vend depuis huit ans, des produits cosmétiques et divers produits de façon ambulante et à son domicile. Houévi Irène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et à Lomé. Houévi Irène désire satisfaire un plus grand nombre de clients par ses produits, mais Houévi Irène ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de rehausser le niveau de son activité. C’est pour ce faire que Houévi Irène sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AMEGNONNA. Le crédit reçu précédemment a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group AMEGNONNA comprises two persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Houévi Irène, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 40 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a welder named Simplice. They have two children, both in school and in their care. She lives together with her children and husband. 

Houévi Irène and her husband jointly cover the diverse family expenses. To achieve that, she has been selling cosmetics and various goods door to door and out of her home for eight years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin and from Lomé. 

Houévi Irène wishes to satisfy a larger number of customers by her products, but she does not have sufficient financial means enabling her to boost her business. And so she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, as are the other members of the group AMEGNONNA. The loan previously received was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Elvira Yolanda

texts.es:
ELVIRA YOLANDA, de 63 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre, tiene siete hijos, vive  con el esposo y un hijo porque los demás son casados,  en el Recinto San Joaquín del cantón Montalvo, Provincia de Los Ríos.

La VRC  San Joaquín  se   encuentra a 15  minutos  de la oficina Montalvo, está conformada por 12 socios.

ELVIRA YOLANDA  se dedica a su negocio  de tienda de víveres, también es costurera, Solicita el crédito para comprar tela para temporada de escuela, arroz, azucar, jabones, shampoo. Con la obtención del crédito  incrementará su tienda.

Las compras y ventas las realiza en la ciudad de Babahoyo. El sueño es incrementar su negocio, mantener una tienda con productos variados.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan  es  la competencia. Su tiempo libre lo dedica a la costura ya que confecciona prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Elvira Yolanda is 63 years old, she lives in a common-law marriage and she has seven children. She lives with her husband and one son, because the others are married, in the precinct of San Joaquín in the canton of Montalvo in the Province of Los Ríos. 

The communal bank of San Joaquín is 15 minutes away from the office in Montalvo and it is composed of 12 members. 

Elvira Yolanda makes a living with her convenience store business and she is also a seamstress. She is requesting the loan to buy fabric for the school season, rice, sugar, bars of soap and shampoo. With the loan she will increase her store. 

Her sales and purchases are done in the city of Babahoyo. Her dream is to increase her business to have a store with varied products. The challenge she faces is the competition.    

Elvira spends her spare time sewing since she makes articles of clothing.

loans.use: to buy fabric for the school season, rice, sugar, bars of soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Roxana Marisol

texts.es:
Roxana quiere invertir nuevamente en el negocio por eso solicita un préstamo para la variedad de mariscos, pescado de varias clases, camarones, filetes y otros mas que son del gusto de los clientes mejorando el negocio para que ella pueda tener mayores ganancias.
Ella considera que la capacidad a aumentado en el negocio debido a las inversiones que ha realizado también ha aumentado sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Roxana wants to make another investment in her business, so she is requesting a loan in order to acquire a variety of seafood. She plans to buy various types of fish, shrimp, fillets, and other products that will please the tastes of her customers. By improving her business, she will be able to generate more income.

Roxana says that the capacity of her business has increased. With the investments she has made, her profits have increased as a result.

loans.use: to buy fish, shellfish, and shrimp.

loans.name: Affossogbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AFFOSSOGBE est composé de quatre personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Virginie Sèwannan est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Virginie Sèwannan est âgé de 45 ans et est mariée à un peintre du nom de Elie. Le couple a cinq enfants, mais un est à leur charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Virginie Sèwannan vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant à charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Virginie Sèwannan vend depuis près de trente ans des sacs de maïs dans son quartier. Virginie Sèwannan s’approvisionne dans une région du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Virginie Sèwannan sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AFFOSSOGBE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group AFFOSSOGBE comprises four persons who lives in the same district. This is the third time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, Virginie Sèwannan, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 45 years old and married to a painter named Elie. They have five children, but one is in their care. All the children have had schooling. 

Virginie Sèwannan lives together with her husband and dependent child. The diverse household expenses are covered by the couple. To achieve that, she has been selling sacks of corn in her district for nearly thirty years. She gets her supplies from a region in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, Virginie Sèwannan is requesting, along with the other members of the group AFFOSSOGBE, a third loan from ALIDé. The loans received previously were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Une Femme De Plus I Group

texts.fr: UNE FEMME DE PLUS I est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Françoise (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans. Françoise est mariée à un chauffeur nommé Clément. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Françoise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Françoise n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Françoise vend des friperies de façon ambulante. Françoise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’élargir son activité, Françoise sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe UNE FEMME DE PLUS I. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
UNE FEMME DE PLUS I is a group of four persons whose members reside in the same district. The group's representative, Françoise (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 37 years old. She is married to a driver named Clément. They have three children, all in school and in their care. Françoise lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

Françoise never attended school. To cope with her different expenses, she sells used clothing door to door. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and aiming to expand her business, Françoise is requesting, along with the other members of the group UNE FEMME DE PLUS I, a second loan from ALIDé. They will use this loan to make more profit. The loan received previously was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and all of them are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of bananas.  She generates additional income through farming.  Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a track which she can use to deliver her bananas and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house but the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.es:
Baltazar es un hombre de 68 años de edad, es viudo y tiene un hijo a su cargo. Vive en casa propia en el caserío Peñarol, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Su localidad ya cuenta con algunos servicios básicos.
La actividad que desarrolla la titular es la cosecha de limón en parcela de 3 hectáreas propias y a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino y aves de corral. La actividad se la reparten entre hija mayor la cual vive con él y sus nietos, los cuales se apoyan mutuamente. Se dedica  a la agricultura y crianza de animales hace aproximadamente más de 15 años.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 2400 nuevos soles, los cuales serán invertidos en la compra de mototaxi para el traslado de cosecha de limón de la parcela a la ciudad, para esto cliente cuenta con una parte del valor del vehículo.
texts.en:
Baltazar is a man of 68 years old, he is a widower and he takes care of a son. He lives in his own house in the small country village of Peñarol, in the district of Tambogrande. His village now has some basic services.
The activity that the aforementioned carries out is the harvest of lime in a parcel of 3 self-owned acres and the breeding of cattle, sheep and fowl. The workload is shared with his oldest daughter, as she lives with him, and his grandsons, they all support each other. Baltazar has made a living in agriculture and livestock breeding for approximately more than 15 years.    
The amount of the loan solicited is for 2400 nuevos soles, which will be invested in the purchase of a motorcycle-taxi for the transportation of the lime harvest from the parcel to the city. For the purchase, the client accounts for a part of the value of the vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle-taxi to transport limes to the city.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 4 children and all her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She sells cassava at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of cassava. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land to start growing cassava. She lives in her own house but the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cassava

loans.name: Maria Andalisa

texts.es:
María Andaliza tiene 31 años de edad es casada tiene 5 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
